channel.title: Beginner JS question

item.title: Beginner JS question
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

To correct JavaLearner (no offence) the code would be:

if(24*5 > 2){ console.log('I am right'); } else { console.log('I am wrong'); } [excuse my conventions]
You cannot use .length in this situation as it’s supposed to gather the amount of characters in a string, and here you’re using an int.

Read full topic

item.title: Beginner JS question
item.dc:creator: @JavaLearner JavaLearner
item.description:
@JavaLearner wrote:

Try this.
if
(24*5.length > 2) {
console.log(‘I am right’);
} else {
console.log(‘I am wrong’);
}

Read full topic

item.title: Beginner JS question
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

if
(24*5.length > 2) {
console.log"I am right";
} else {
console.log"I am wrong";
}

what is wrong with this? and to help me learn would you please explain why it is wrong?

Read full topic
